Adult.description: Cave Swallows have paler, buff-colored faces and throats, whereas Cliff Swallows have rusty faces and a dark throat. They also tend to have darker cinnamon rumps than Cliff Swallows.

Adult (American).description: Barn Swallows are similarly colored, but have longer, forked tails and longer, slimmer bodies than Cliff Swallows.

Adult.description: Northern Rough-winged Swallows lack the Cliff Swallow’s pale rump and dark throat.

Adult/immature.description: Chimney Swifts are smaller than swallows, with narrower, more curved wings and much stiffer wingbeats. They are dark overall unlike Cliff Swallows, which have whitish underparts.
Vaux's Swifts are smaller than swallows, with narrower, more curved wings and much stiffer wingbeats. They are much more uniformly dark overall than Cliff Swallows.
